ui
Class Dialog

java.lang.Object
  ui.UI
      ui.Dialog

public class Dialog
extends UI

Sets up the interface the user will see.

Author:
Frederik Nordahl Sabroe, Morten Sørensen

intro

private void intro()
Prints the welcome text when the program starts.

input

public void input(int offset)
           throws java.io.IOException
This is the metheod which receives the input from the keyboard

Parameters:
offset - serves to change where the input from the keyboard will be put in the "indtastet[]" string array
Throws:
java.io.IOException - triggers if buffered reader which comes from stdin is closed

commandCheck

public int commandCheck()
Checks if the command is recognized by the program

Returns:
is one of the constants defined at the start of the program, which is used by start() to trigger the part of the program the user wishes to use

add

private void add()
          throws java.io.IOException
When adding a new course, it checks if there are any of the data in a wrong format (eg. too high semester number, or the course ID contains letters).

Throws:
java.io.IOException - triggers if buffered reader which comes from stdin is closed

courseCheck

private int courseCheck()
Checks if the form of courseID is a possible courseID

Returns:
true if the form is correct, else false

semesterCheck

private int semesterCheck()
Checks if the form of semester number is a possible semester number

Returns:
true if the form is correct, else false

remove

private void remove()
Remove a course from the users study plan. If the format of the inputted courseID is wrong, it will ask for a new courseID

helpMe

private void helpMe()
Prints the hjælp-function. If the funktion is followed by an argument, it will print an more detailed discription of how to use the function (if it exists).

printDatabaseList

private void printDatabaseList()
Prints the list of available courses

showPlan

private void showPlan()
Prints the plan as is

                 throws java.io.IOException

Throws:
java.io.IOException

Saves the current studyplan

private void loadPlan()
Load a previously saved studyplan

readInput

private java.lang.String readInput()
                            throws java.io.IOException
Trims the input to get rid of spaces in the ends. If the input turns to null, it will throw an exception.

Returns:
the input without spaces
Throws:
java.io.IOException - is thrown if the input is null

end

private void end()
Exits the program.
